lg.l: Right trusty & So forth; we lett you to know,
We are very ill us'd by You mortals below:
For first; I have often by Chymists been told,
Tho' I know nothing on't, tis I, that make Gold.
Which, when You have gott, You So carefully hide it;
That, Since I was born, I hardly have 'Spy'd it.
Then; it must be allow'd, wherever I shine;
I forward ye Grass, & ripen the Vine.
To me ye good fellows Apply for Relief,
Without whom, they can gett neither Claret nor Beef.
Yet their Wine & their Victuals those Curmudgeon Lubbards
Lock up from my Sight in Pantries & Cupboards.
That I have an ill Eye, they wickedly think,
And taint all their Meat & Sow'r their drink.
But thirdly & lastly, it must be allow'd
I alone can inspire the Poetical Crowd.
This is gratefully own'd by each boy in the College;
Whom if I inspire, 'tis not to my Knowledge.
This every Pretender in Rhime will admitt,
without troubling his Head about judgment or Witt.
Those Gentlemen use me with Kindness & freedom;
And, as for their works, when I please I may read \del·th\'em;
They lie open on Purpose, on Counters & Stalls,
And the titles I view, when I shine on ye walls.
But a Comrade of Yours, that Traytor Delany,
Whom I, for Your Sake, have us'd better than Any,
And, of my meer motion & \del·good\Special good Grace,
Intended in time to Succeed in this Place,
On Tuesday the tenth, he Seditiously came
With a certain false traitress, one Stella by Name,
To ye Deanery House; & on the North glass,
Where, for fear of ye Cold, I never can Pass
Then & there, Vi et Armis, with a certain Utensil
In value five Shillings, in English a Pencil,
Did maliciously, falsly & traytrouly write,
While Stella aforesaid Stood by with the Light.
My Sister has lately depos'd upon Oath,
That she Stop'd in her course to look on Them both.
That Stella was helping, abetting & aiding,
And Still, as He writt, Stood smiling & reading:
That her Eyes were as bright as my Self at Noon-day,
But her graceful black locks were mingled with Grey:
And by ye description I certainly know,
Tis ye Same Nymph J courted Some ten Years agoe.
Whom\del·,\ when I with ye best of My Talents endued,
On her promise of Yielding, She Acted ye Prude.
That Some verses w\del·ith·add·ere\ written with felonious intent
Direct to ye North, where I never went.
That ye Letters Appear'd revers'd on the Pane
But in Stella's bright Eyes were placed right again;
wherein, she distinctly could read ev'ry line,
And presently guess'd yt ye Fancy was mine.
She can swear to ye Person, whom oft she has Seen
At night between Cavan-Street & College-Green.
Now You See why his Verses So Seldom are Shown;
The reason is plain; they are none of his own:
And observe while You live, yt no man is Shy
To discover ye goods he comes honestly by.
If I light on a thought, he will certainly Steel it,
And When he has gott it, finds ways to conceal it.
Of all ye fine things, he keeps in the dark,
There's Scarce one in ten, but what has my mark.
And let them be Seen by ye World, if he dare,
I'le make it Appear they are all Stolen Ware.
But as for the Poem, he writt on the Sash
I think I have now gott him under the Lash.
My Sister transcrib'd it last night to his Sorrow
And the Public Shall See it, if I live till to·morrow.
Thro' ye Zodiack round it shall quickly be Spread,
In all parts of ye Globe, where ye Language is read.
He knows very well, I ne'er gave a refusal
When he ask'd for my aid, in the forms that are usual.
But ye Secret is this, I did lately intend
To write a few Verses on You, as my friend:
I studied a fortnight, before I could find,
As I rode in my Chariot, a thought to my mind:
And resolv'd ye next winter, for that is my time,
when the days are ye Shortest, to gett it in Rhyme.
Till then it was lock'd in my Box at Parnassus
when this Subtle Compaion, in hopes to Surpass us,
Conveys out my Paper of Hints by a Trick,
For I think in my Conscience he deals with Old-Nick:
And from my old Stock provided with Topicks,
He getts to a Window beyond both the Tropicks,
There out of my Sight, against ye North Zone,
Writes down my conceits, & calls them his own:
And you like a Cully ye Bubble can Swallow,
Now who but Delany can write like Apollo?
High Treason by Statute; but here You object
He only Stole hints, but ye verse is correct;
Tho' the thought be Apollo's, tis finely exprest:
So a thief steals my Horse, & getts him well drest.
Now whereas ye Criminal Seems past Repentance,
We Phœbus think fitt to proceed to his Sentence.
Since Delany has dar'd like Prometheus, his Sire,
To climb to our Region & there to Steal Fire;
We order a Vultur in shape of ye Spleen
To prey on his Liver & not to be Seen.
And we order our Subjects, of ev'ry degree,
To believe, all his verses were written by Me:
And, under ye Pain of our highest displeasure,
To call nothing his, but the Rhyme & the measure.
And lastly for Stella, just out of her Prime,
I am too much already revenged by Time.
In return to her Scorn, I send her diseases;
And will now be her Friend, whenever she pleases;
And ye Gifts I bestow'd her, will find her a Lover,
Tho' she lives till she's Grey, as a Badger, all over.
